content.step1: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease two 8-inch round cake pans and line bottoms with parchment paper.
content.step2: Mix 2 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, 1 ½ cups granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons baking powder, and 1 teaspoon salt in a large bowl.
content.step3: Combine 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 cup whole milk, and 2 large eggs in another bowl. Whisk until smooth.
content.step4: Add the cocoa mixture to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Add ¼ cup vegetable oil and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
content.step5: Divide the batter evenly between prepared pans and smooth tops. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
content.step6: Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Frost with your favorite chocolate frosting.
